Package ecs

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • ecs.Entity
  • public class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
    The Entity class describes an Entity used by Engine and System. An Entity is like a powerful bag of as many Component as you want.
    Author:
    Alexis SKRZYNSKI (alexis.skrzynski@viacesi.fr) aka NeoDarkFire
    See Also:
    Component, Engine, System

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Entity()
      Default constructor.
      Entity​(Component comp)
      Creates an Entity with one specified Component.
      Entity​(java.util.Collection<Component> comps)
      Creates an Entity with a Collection of Component.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity()
        Default constructor. Creates an empty Entity, without any Component.

      • Entity

        public Entity​(Component comp)
        Creates an Entity with one specified Component.

      • Entity

        public Entity​(java.util.Collection<Component> comps)
        Creates an Entity with a Collection of Component.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Example : "Entity #1"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Gets the unique ID identifying the Entity.
        Returns:
        The ID of the Entity.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys the Entity. If the Entity has components, destroy them. If the Entity is registered to an Engine, tells it to discard the Entity.

      • attach

        public Component attach​(Component comp)
        Attach a Component to the Entity. If there is already a Component for that Component class, detach it.
        Parameters:
        comp - A Component.
        Returns:
        The old Component, when applicable.
        See Also:
        detach(java.lang.Class<? extends ecs.Component>)

      • detach

        public Component detach​(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> compClass)
        Detaches a Component from the Entity.
        Parameters:
        compClass - The class of the Component to detach.
        Returns:
        the old Component.

      • get

        public Component get​(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> compClass)
        Gets the Component attached to the Entity.
        Parameters:
        compClass - The class of the Component.
        Returns:
        The Component.

      • set

        public Component set​(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> compClass,
                     Component comp)
        Updates the Component associated without notifying the Engine. A Component must already be registered with the Entity.
        Parameters:
        compClass - The class of the Component.
        comp - The Component.
        Returns:
        The old Component.

      • allComponents

        public java.util.Collection<? extends Component> allComponents()
        Get all the Components of the Entity.
        Returns:
        A Collection of Component.

      • has

        public boolean has​(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> compClass)
        Get whether if the Entity has a specified Component.
        Parameters:
        compClass - The class of the Component.
        Returns:
        True if the Entity has the Component.

      • has

        public boolean has​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<? extends Component>> compClasses)
        Get whether if the Entity has multiple specified Components.
        Parameters:
        compClasses - A Collection of Component classes.
        Returns:
        True if the Entity has all the Components.
